intro: Henriettella ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman's henriettella, is a rare and small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
